'''Donald "Don" D. Lapre''' (born May [[1964]]) is an American TV [[pitchman]]. Lapre is a high school [[dropping out|dropout]]<ref name=autogenerated1>{{cite web|url=http://web.archive.org/web/20000824160429/www.phoenixnewtimes.com/issues/2000-01-13/feature.html/page2.html|author=Leigh Farr|title=Don Wan|accessdate=2007-03-12|work=[[Phoenix New Times]]}}</ref>, who became a [[multi-level marketing]] [[salesman]] and [[infomercial]] personality. His work has involved such products as "The Greatest Vitamin in the World" and the "Making Money Package", and he was criticized as selling questionable business plans that often did not work for his clients.
'''Donald "Don" D. Lapre''' (born May [[1964]]) is an American TV [[pitchman]]. Lapre is a high school [[dropping out|dropout]]<ref name=autogenerated1>{{cite web|url=http://web.archive.org/web/20000824160429/www.phoenixnewtimes.com/issues/2000-01-13/feature.html/page2.html|author=Leigh Farr|title=Don Wan|accessdate=2007-03-12|work=[[Phoenix New Times]]}}</ref>, who became a [[multi-level marketing]] [[salesman]] and [[infomercial]] personality. His work has involved such products as "The Greatest Vitamin in the World" and the "Making Money Package", and he was criticized as selling questionable business plans that often did not work for his clients.
